content: inside the toad and then when you re ready to remove the hat you can just pull out the tacking thread you could also put a thin elastic on to the bottom of the hat like a party hat or i-cord some ties to fig 5 it the choice is up to you both clown hats in fig 6 are being held on with straight pins fig 6 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 5 clown collar using 2 25 mm straight needles and white crochet thread cast on 107 stitches row 1-7 starting with a knit row stocking stitch for 7 row row 8 k1 yo k2tog to the end row 9-15 starting with a knit row stocking stitch for 7 row cast off leaving a long yarn tail for sewing at this point the collar should look like fig 7 now we re going to fold the two halves of the collar wrong sides together which creates a little v-shaped detail at the edge of the collar as in fig 8 using your cast off tail sew the cast-on and the cast-off edges of the collar together with the backstitch sewing stitch will look like fig 9 when completed now you can check the collar s length around your toad s neck and shoulders the collar should be anywhere from 1 to 2 inches too big then we re going to take a long length of the white crochet thread and thread it into a yarn needle hand- sewing a running stitch across the top where the cast-on and cast-off edges are sewn together then gently pull your running stitch to pucker the collar fig 7 fig 8 together until it becomes the right size for your toad s neck see fig 10 to attach the collar you can use straight pins as i have done in fig 10 or you can tack the collar on to the back of the toad s neck with thread you could also sew on a tiny button and make a clasp or make i-cord ties for it *note if you re interested in making a collar for your lady spinderella doll the pattern is done in exactly the same way as for the toad but you only cast on 27 stitches instead of 107 fig 9 fig 10 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 6 and voila your toad clown or lady spinderella clown is all set for valentine s day *note to make your toad a knitted heart to hold i used a free ravelry pattern by louise bollanos called small knitted heart it can be found here https //www ravelry
